segments.text: I'm stunned by how the water just keeps flowing over the sink edge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is polishing her plate, eyes glued to it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her dress and apron look so proper, yet puddle at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Behind her, the boy's on a stool grabbing from the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Didn't expect the stool to be leaning like that— scary!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's poised, hand up, like she's in on the secret.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window's open to a serene garden; what a contrast.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Curtains tied back, letting in light on this hidden chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes stacked neatly, but water's nearing them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: No plug in the sink— that's the surprise culprit.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinet's full of cookies; they're bold little thieves.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This ordinary kitchen hides so much action.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I never thought a simple drawing could show such tension.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor's getting slick; accidents loom.
segments.speaker: PAR
